word:
Chap. 35 - To J. E. White (fragment)

Fragment of letter to Edson White              W-14a-1889 
                                               Chicago, Ill 
                                               [Cir. April 7, 1889] ct. W-66 


     If I can possibly get off from the appointment to the Scandinavians I will do it and return home and see what you are all about. I shall be glad to have No. 33 out for the people need it. I am up writing at three o'clock in the morning. There are many questions to be considered and settled. It is understood that you are going to Kansas meeting. I cannot lay out the matter clearly in my mind.
